page.title: 03Meldrum and Bourtie Parishes
page.content: The town of Oldmeldrum dominates from its position on the ridge but residents of surrounding farmland consider themselves separate from the town, and align themselves with the old parish boundaries of Meldrum and Bourtie. The town covers just about half a square mile, whereas the parish of Meldrum covers 8000 acres to the north and east and Bourtie 5500 acres to the south. Population figures for 1984 give an estimate of 1770 residents in Meldrum parish, of whom 1580 live in the town; Bourtie has a population of 265. Meldrum acivities centre on the town but Bourtie is a thriving community whose farmers organize an annual dance - the Bourtie Farmers' - in November and farmers' wives meet every month in the church hall for activities like flower bulb shows and homemade jam & cake displays
